title: Experimental study of the roots of various graph polynomials
description: Recently, Barvinok introduced a new method to approximate various partition functions and graph polynomials, via taylor expansion and certain subgraph counting techniques. The crucial part of Barvinok's method is to rule out the possibility that the root of the graph polynomial lies in a certain region. In this project, you will study the distribution of these roots, subject to changes of various parameters.
goal: Study the distribution of the roots of graph polynomials
completion_criteria: Study the distribution of the roots of graph polynomials, especially their relationship with phase transitions in statistical physics.

title: Gadget calculator
description: Gadgets play a central role in many complexity theoretic hardness proofs. Especially, in recent studies of the complexity of counting problems, more and more complicated gadgets are built. So far, most of the analysis is done by hand, and this project aims to develop an automatic way to compute these gadgets.
goal: Develop an automatic tool for gadget calculation
completion_criteria: Develop an automatic tool that for any given gadget (as a graph fragment), outputs its effective function (or tensor).

title: Better ski maps via domain-specific modelling: modelling workbench for resort designers
description:
Ski resorts have multiple pistes, which skiers access using lifts. Traditional ski maps - see [1] for example - are topographical. They can be confusing to interpret, especially under stress or in poor conditions; for example, it can be difficult to answer questions like:

Q1) Can I reach this lift from that piste, or are they just geographically close? (This is particularly hard when the map is at small scale, which it typically is for large ski domains.)

Q2) In which direction does this piste run? (This is particularly a problem for short piste sections where neither end is a lift; sometimes this is disambiguated with arrows, but putting arrows on every piste is impractical in the traditional setting.)

Q3) How can I get from A to B satisfying a constraint such as "nothing harder than a blue run"?

For skiers who wish to stick to pistes, most of the topographical information is irrelevant, so we may contemplate better ways to display and exploit the relevant information. An obvious inspiration is the London Tube map, and this connection has been made in an artistic context (see reference [2]). It would be desirable to be able to use the same basic information about a ski resort to produce both types of map, and to use it in different ways. Therefore this project will start by defining a simple domain-specific modelling language (DSML) for ski resorts, in which the model elements are lifts, pistes etc. This part will be done in cooperation with any student(s) taking the related projects (with the obviously similar names): the DSML will serve as the interface between the software developed in the different projects.


The focus of this project is to develop a modelling workbench for ski resort designers. (They are likely to be updating an existing model rather than creating a new one, but both should be possible.) Some of this can be done with generic domain specific modelling tools such as are discussed in the SDM course, but the specific needs of this application also need to be considered. For example, the resort designer will want to maintain certain invariants such as "no dead ends" (the skier cannot reach any place in the resort from which there is nowhere to go) and perhaps "no stranded beginners" and others that would need careful formulation. Between seasons they may need to undertake such tasks as adding new runs, modifying the paths of old ones, changing lift types. During a season, the same interface might be used to consider the impact of closing certain areas/lifts/runs - for example, if one run has to be closed because of avalanche risk, are there other runs or lifts that should also be closed as a consequence, to avoid violating the properties?


I would want the software produced in this project to be engineered carefully, well tested and documented and released under an open source licence, in order that it can be built on at a later date.
goal: Develop a domain-specific modelling language to describe the pistes and lifts in a ski domain, and use this as a basis for a modelling workbench for resort designers.
completion_criteria: A domain-specific modelling language to describe the pistes and lifts in a ski domain has been developed, and a modelling workbench has been built which a designer can use to develop a model in the DSML that is known to satisfy appropriate properties.

title: Better ski maps via domain-specific modelling: Android app
description:
Ski resorts have multiple pistes, which skiers access using lifts. Traditional ski maps - see [1] for example - are topographical. They can be confusing to interpret, especially under stress or in poor conditions; for example, it can be difficult to answer questions like:

Q1) Can I reach this lift from that piste, or are they just geographically close? (This is particularly hard when the map is at small scale, which it typically is for large ski domains.)

Q2) In which direction does this piste run? (This is particularly a problem for short piste sections where neither end is a lift; sometimes this is disambiguated with arrows, but putting arrows on every piste is impractical in the traditional setting.)

Q3) How can I get from A to B satisfying a constraint such as "nothing harder than a blue run"?

For skiers who wish to stick to pistes, most of the topographical information is irrelevant, so we may contemplate better ways to display and exploit the relevant information. An obvious inspiration is the London Tube map, and this connection has been made in an artistic context (see reference [2]). It would be desirable to be able to use the same basic information about a ski resort to produce both types of map, and to use it in different ways. Therefore this project will start by defining a simple domain-specific modelling language (DSML) for ski resorts, in which the model elements are lifts, pistes etc. This part will be done in cooperation with any student(s) taking the related projects (with the obviously similar names): the DSML will serve as the interface between the software developed in the different projects.


The focus of this project is to develop an Android app - instantiable for any model of a ski resort expressed in the DSML - for use by skiers in the resort. It should use location services, where available, to tell the user where they were in terms of the DSML model. It should offer them useful functionality which might include: offer them options of where to go next, or tell them how to get to a specified place, taking into account characteristics that the user could set in the app. It need not have a map interface at all, but if the related "concrete syntax" project is taken up, it might be interesting to collaborate to give it one based on that project's work.

I would want the software produced in this project to be engineered carefully, well tested and documented and released under an open source licence, in order that it can be built on at a later date.
goal: Develop a domain-specific modelling language to describe the pistes and lifts in a ski domain, and use this as a basis for an Android app for skiers
completion_criteria: An Android app based on an appropriate DSML has been built, that can provide a skier with useful information based on their current location and their preferences.

title: Cohort study in skills assessment of trainee surgeons wearing Orient specks using a laparoscopy (keyhole surgery) simulator
description:
[This project will be undertaken in collaboration with Dr. Roland Partridge, Paediatric Surgery, Royal Hospital for Children, Glasgow]


Laparoscopy, or keyhole surgery, is a minimally invasive surgical technique. Unlike conventional open surgery, which requires large incisions to access internal organs, laparoscopy is performed by manipulating long instruments with active tips, together with a camera and light source, through small entry holes in the skin.

Laparoscopic surgery requires considerable skill and can take years of training. In addition to medical expertise, manual dexterity is required in both hands to manipulate the instruments.  Surgical simulators such as the eoSim take-home laparoscopic simulator [1] create safe environments in which key skills can be practiced extensively. Previous research [2] introduced performance measures (based on the following four metrics: acceleration, ambidexterity, smoothness and distance traversed) for the manual dexterity component of surgical performance, using inertial motion sensor data from Orient-5 specks attached to the two needles, and clustering them in three categories: novice, intermediate and advanced.

This project will first study the impact of different placements of the Orient sensors - on the wrists (preferable for ergonomic reasons),on the  back of the hands,  on the upper arm, compared to their placement on the needles. The performance for a given set of manual dexterity tasks will be evaluated systematically on a cohort of surgical trainees. Second, data collected from the cohort of trainee surgeons issued with the eoSim simulator will be analysed for improvement over time using the performance indicators.  A ranking algorithm will be used to judge their performance in comparison to the rest of the cohort and feedback provided on the metrics to  improve to raise their performance measure.
goal: Assessment of  manual dexterity of trainee surgeons during keyhole surgery wearing wrist sensors – the Orients specks – when using a laparoscopy simulator.
completion_criteria: 1. A systematic evaluation of the impact of the placement on the performance metrics for a set of trainee surgeons using the laparoscopic simulator                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           +
2. Study on a cohort of trainee surgeons to track their improvement over time for a given set of tasks using the laparoscopic simulator

title: A Tiny RISC-V Based Teaching System for the Computer Design Laboratory
description: This project will create an experimental Tiny RISC-V CPU design that runs on a Xilinx Zync-7010 FPGA board. The design will be simple and modular, so that individual parts of the design can be easily extended or modified by future students, perhaps as an exercise in the Computer Design course. The system may make use of the attached ARM Cortex A9 dual-core host system, to act as a front-end to the Tiny RISC-V processor (which will of course be implemented within the FPGA fabric). The front end system will load programs into the target system's memory and run (or single-step) the target processor, displaying the results of each instruction. Due to the nature of the project, only students who have previous experience with the Zync-7010 from the 2017-18 Computer Design laboratory will be permitted to take this project. The project can be taken by more than one student, if demand is high. In that case, the project may be divided into components.
goal: To produce a laboratory exercise for the Computer Design course, based on the Tiny RISC-V instructon set, which allows students to experiment with different aspects of microprocessor design
completion_criteria: A working Tiny RISC-V system.

title: Hardware Support for Convolutional Neural Network Applications
description: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) are commonly used in image processing, for applications ranging from facial and object recognition to driverless cars. The goal of this project is to design a hardware sub-system that performs highly-parallel CNN calculations, trading speed for parallelism. The sub-system will be designed to operate on an FPGA, such as the Xilinx Zync-7010, which many UG4 students will have encountered already in the UG3 Computer Design laboratory. In this project, the FPGA fabric will be hosted by a dual-core ARM Cortex A9 system, which will be programmed to provide test images and receive results from the CNN sub-system. The system will then be evaluated in terms of performance and accuracy.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      +
goal: Design a coprocessor for standalone CNN computations, attach it to a dual-core ARM Cortex A9 system, and implement it in a Zync-7010 FPGA on a Zybo PCB.
completion_criteria: A system that recognizes an object in a presented image, using a CNN sub-system designed by the student and implemented in an FPGA.

title: Enhancing the RISC-V Instruction Set Architecture
description:
The RISC-V Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) is an open ISA that is maintained by the RISC-V Foundation [1]. It has been designed to compete with current popular ISAs, such as those found in modern desktops, servers, and even embedded or mobile devices. The purpose of this project is to identify ways to enhance the performance of RISC-V. This will begin by benchmarking [2] the RISC-V ISA in comparison with existing ISAs that are widely used in industry, such as x86, ARM and perhaps others too, if time permits. The second step will be to identify some ways in which the RISC-V ISA could be enhanced with new instructions, to improve performance. The proposed enhancements will be evaluated by modifying an existing public-domain RISC-V compiler to target the new instructions, and re-running the benchmarks.

This is potentially an extensive project, and is suitable for 2-year MInf projects.
goal: To identify weaknesses in the RISC-V Instruction Set Architecture, propose enhancements, and evaluate them through performance benchmarks
completion_criteria: This project is in two main parts: (1) a comparative analysis of the RISC-V ISA, and (2) a set of properly-evaluated proposals for enhancing the RISC-V ISA.

title: Fourier Transform Processor for Low-power Heterogeneous Systems
description: The goals of this project are to design, implement and evaluate a special-purpose stream processor for computing discrete Fourier transforms [1, 2]. Such a processor would be incorporated within a transform pipeline for broadband communications devices, where it could be programmed to perform forward or inverse DFT calculations, of varying power-of-two dimensions. The IDFT calculation could be capable of performing Hermitian-symmetric extension of the input array, in order to ensure real-valued outputs [3]. Arithmetic will be performed using fractional fixed-point types, scaled appropriately.The implementation will be a synthesizable Verilog model developed using a Xilinx Zync 7010 FPGA board, similar to those used in the INF3 Computer Design course. Several software libraries for FFT computation exist, and can be referred to during the project [4].
goal: To design, implement and evaluate a streaming processor for performing Fourier transforms.
completion_criteria: A complete project will include a Verilog implementation of the FFT stream processor capable of both an FFT and an IFFT calculation.

title: Counterfactual fairness: a logical formalisation
description:
Can machine learning models be made fair? Can we elimination biases in the data and the learning?

Some recent papers have looked at formalising fairness using the notion of counterfactual models. The purpose of this task is to put this in a logical language, design a modal logic for counterfactual reasoning.

A successful thesis puts together some formal definitions in an expressive modal logic, and studies semantical properties.

Background / Prerequisites

- A very strong background in mathematical logic, especially first order logic and modal logic
- Strong foundations in probability theory


Reasoning about knowledge and probability. Halpern and Fagin. JACM.

https://arxiv.org/abs/1106.2647

A First-Order Logic of Probability and Only Knowing in Unbounded Domains. Belle, V.; Lakemeyer, G.; and Levesque, H. In AAAI, 2016.

https://arxiv.org/abs/1703.06856
goal: The purpose of this task is to put this in a logical language, design a modal logic for counterfactual reasoning.
completion_criteria: A successful thesis puts together some formal definitions in an expressive modal logic, and studies semantical properties.

title: A model-counting approach to the repair of faulty representations
description:
Formal representations of knowledge are required by autonomous agents to answer queries, make plans, communicate with other agents, interpret sensory data, etc. But these representations are often faulty, e.g., inconsistent or incomplete. This may be because: the source of data encoded within them is unreliable; the environment they represent changes over time; they are applied to a new task for which their coverage is inadequate; etc. Reformation is a technique, developed at Edinburgh, for detecting representational faults via reasoning failures and proposing repairs. Unfortunately, it proposes too many repairs and we need mechanisms for choosing between them. Additionally, representations may contain more than one fault. We prefer repairs that maximise the number of faults they simultaneously repair and minimising the number of new faults they introduce. This calls for assigning degrees of inconsistency and incompleteness to representations, so that we can compare rival repairs using these measures. 

The maximum satisfiability problem (MAX-SAT) is the problem of determining the maximum number of clauses, of a given Boolean formula in conjunctive normal form, that can be made true by an assignment of truth values to the variables of the formula. There are efficient algorithms for MAX-SAT. It is one of a family of related algorithms that we can employ to measure the degrees of inconsistency and incompleteness that we need to compare rival repairs. 


The project will involve: (1) implementing algorithms to reformulate representations in Boolean formulae in CNF; (2) applying various SAT-based algorithms to these CNF formulae; (3) applying this to compare different representational repairs.
goal: To apply a suite of SAT-based tools to assess the degrees of inconsistency and incompleteness of faulty knowledge representations and, hence, to choose between rival repairs.
completion_criteria: An implementation of a system for comparing repairs to faulty representations using the techniques above, and an evaluation of this system on a test set.

title: Implementation of hybrid automata
description: Hybrid systems (such as a thermostat) involve both discrete and continuous features. Hybrid automata have been introduced to model such systems. They are a formal model that combine finite state machines with continuously evolving variables. In this project the aim is to restrict attention to linear hybrid automata, where the continuous changes are constrained to be linear.This still covers a wide variety of hybrid systems. There are numerous aspects of linear hybrid automata that can be examined. Questions about state reachabilities constitute one concern; another is model checking using temporal logics (with constraints). It is left open exactly which features will be implemented.
goal: To implement some decidable  features of linear hybrid automata and model some hybrid systems
completion_criteria: A system implemented that exhibits the semantic behaviour of a linear hybrid automaton.

title: The benefits of deforestation
description: When using a functional programming language, it is often natural to employ a compositional style that leads to the generation of a lot of intermediate data structures. "Deforestation" refers to a technique for transforming programs to remove such intermediate data structures, reducing run-time costs.The goal of this programs is to compare the theoretically-predicted optimisation gain of deforestation with what is achieved in practice by a modern compiler for a functional programming language. Measuring this will involve adding appropriate instrumentation to observe internal heap structures generated by the compiled program.A similar experiment was done in 1995 by Stefan Gruner at the University of Amsterdam, using a subset of the Miranda language and the FAST compiler. A secondary objective of this project is to see how the results achieved by a modern compiler for a functional language, probably GHC for Haskell, compares with Gruner's results.
goal: Compare the theoretically-predicted optimisation gain of "deforestation" techniques with what is actually achieved in practice, and compare with measurements made in 1995.
completion_criteria: Implementation of instrumentation that enables measurement of intermediate heap structures generated by a compiled functional program, used for experiments on how these measurements compares with theoretically-predicted optimisation gains of deforestation.

title: File system for SSDs using Intel SPDK
description:
In this project, we will design and implement a file-system supporting POSIX APIs  for SSDs using Intel SPDK. 

As modern datacenters are increasingly deploying fast SSDs for storing the data -- the conventional disk-based filesystems are inefficient. The major bottleneck stems from the high overheads in the operating systems kernel. To overcome this limitation, we propose to build a file system that bypasses the operating system. In our design, the file-system (userspace file system) will directly interact with the modern SSDs using the Intel SPDK library.
goal: To build a file-system supporting POSIX APIs  for SSDs using Intel SPDK
completion_criteria: To design and implementation the complete filesystem.

title: Effect inference
description:
The type of an expression describes the value that is produces when evaluated. But the evaluation of an expression does more than produce a value: input/output may be performed, exceptions may be raised or handled, storage may be utilised, assignments may take place, etc. These are called effects. It is possible to incorporate information about effects in the type of an expression. So a function that has type int->int in ML might be given a more informative type along the lines (int handling overflow) -> (int possibly raising divide-by-zero).

Several years ago, Paul Flanagan designed and implemented an effect system for exceptions and mutable variables in a subset of ML, building on a proposal by Pessaux and Leroy. The goal of this project will be to build on and extend this work, or do something similar in a subset of Haskell or Links. Several directions are possible, and a project would probably focus on one or two of these.

  1. Modify the system to handle a larger subset of ML, a different functional language, and/or another class of effects.
  2. Improve the effect system for mutable variables by dealing appropriately with aliasing.
  3. Improve the implementation by thinking of a good way to present type/effect information without overwhelming the user with information.
goal: Design and implement a simple language with a type system that includes information about effects.
completion_criteria: A system implemented that extends/modifies Flanagan's system in one of the ways indicated above.

title: Topics in the Problem of Representation
description: There are a number of possible projects within this subject area, and  the precise details of a specific topic should be discussed and agreed between the student and supervisor, according to the student's background and interests. Potential themes include various attempts to `naturalize' representational content (e.g. Dretske, Millikan, etc.), critiques of the computational pardigm based on representational content (e.g. Searle), positive approaches to the symbol grounding problem and the assignment of semantical value to internal cognitive processing, narrow mental states versus externalism and embodied cognition, different slants on the problem supplied by different computational architectures (e.g. connectionism, dynamical systems theory), moves to dismiss the problem altogether (behavior based robotics). The project will be primarily discursive/analytical and verbal-based, requiring exploration and discussion of background literature, critical evaluation of relevant arguments and positions.
goal: To investigate a selected topic in the general area of the problem of representation.
completion_criteria: Production of a satisfactorily organized, researched and written piece of work.

title: Topics in the Problem of Consciousness
description:
There are a number of possible projects within this subject area, and the precise details of a specific topic should be discussed and agreed between the student and supervisor, according to the student's educational background and interests. Potential themes include functionalist or information processing theories of consciousness, critiques of
functionalism, physicalist and identity theories, critiques of physicalism (e.g. Jackson), neural correlates of consciousness, the problems of dualism and epiphenomenalism. The literature and issues of controversy in this area are quite extensive, and the foregoing list of potential topics is far from exhaustive. The project will be primarily discursive/analytical and verbal based, requiring exploration and discussion of background literature, critical evaluation of relevant arguments and positions.
goal: To investigate a selected topic in the general area of the problem of consciousness.
completion_criteria: Production of a satisfactorily organized, researched and written piece of work.

title: Computation in Physical Systems
description:
A fundamental question regarding computation viewed as a physical phenomenon concerns the criteria under which a physical system can properly be said to implement an abstract formal procedure. Employing a 'simple mapping account' Putnam offers a proof of the thesis that every open physical system can be interpreted as the implementation of every finite state automaton. Such results have been used to argue that computation is not an intrinsic property of physical systems, but rather is purely observer-relative, and in turn that the computational theory of mind (CTM) is in principle trivial. In response, defenders of CTM have proposed additional constraints on the notion of implementation,
including semantic, causal, mechanistic and counterfactual restrictions. There is a wide range of literature and competing views in this dispute, and plenty of theoretical terrain to explore. The project will be primarily discursive/analytical and verbal based, requiring discussion and analysis of background literature, explanation and critical evaluation of respective arguments and positions.
goal: To investigate a selected conceptual theme regarding the nature and status of computation viewed as a physical (as opposed to purely mathematical) phenomenon.
completion_criteria: Production of a satisfactorily organized, researched and written piece of work.

title: Interactive Chromatin Visualization in Augmented Reality with MS HoloLens
description:
Chromatin is a name for DNA strings, tightly folded in 3D and packed onto a very narrow space inside the chromosome. 

This project is about exploring visualization and interaction techniques in augmented reality explore 3D chromatin structures with holograms. Goal of the project is to provide a fluid workflow between holographic representation and desktop environment. The project requires elaboration of an interaction concept with the 3D structures and listing tasks required by the biologists, for Microsoft HoloLens.

The project will be done in collaboration with biologists from the Beatson Institute for Cancer Research, Glasgow and we aim for regular meetings. 

The project requires enhanced programming skills, ideally WebGL, C#, and familiarity with Unity.
goal: Design and development of interactive visualization interface for augmented reality on HoloLens
completion_criteria: Successful implementation, deployment, and validation of design choices through a participatory and iterative design process.

title: Developing an Intention Prediction Model using Kinematic-Dynamic Data for Human-Robot Collaborative Manipulation
description:
A promising development in the future of robotics is the capability of humans and robots to work side by side [1]. When we examine this, we realize that robots have to be temporally or spatially separated from humans to ensure humans’ safety. In this project, we venture to develop the required sensing system and intention/prediction models, to allow robots to collaboratively perform co-manipulation tasks with humans [2,3], as naturally as two humans would do.

The first phase of the project concerns the collection of kinematic and interaction force data, similar to [4], during the execution of manipulation tasks. A human subject will perform specific manipulation tasks on a target object. An Xsens suit will capture relative kinematic data of the subject. The Vicon motion tracking system will be used to collect absolute kinematic data of specific parts of the subject, and the pose of the manipulated object. The ATI Force Torque sensors will be used to collect interaction forces between the subject and the manipulated object. The final dataset will consist of fused relative and absolute kinematic data, which are time-wise synchronized with the respective interaction force data.

The second phase concerns developing intention prediction models using the kinematic-force dataset. Given kinematic and force interaction data of an agent manipulating an object alone or as a member of a dyad, the model should be able to predict the agents’ intended future actions. In other words, the model is a function that maps the state of the agent (current and previous kinematic-force measurements), to agent’s intended future actions with respect to the manipulation task. The development of the model will require: -Literature review on different intention prediction methods, -Feature extraction from sequential data, -Identify the most relevant features in the data, that are correlated to the particular co-manipulation setup, -Implementation of a baseline intention prediction method, based only on kinematic data [5]. -Ideally, implementation of method, that considers both kinematic and force data to predict agent’s intended actions. -Experimental evaluation of the methods developed on human-human co-manipulation scenarios with different goodness criteria.
goal: Assuming full observability of human agent’s action history in manipulation tasks, the goal is to predict agent’s future actions with respect to the manipulation tasks.
completion_criteria: An integrated system, that allows to capture synchronizes kinematic and force data of a human, while performing a manipulation task. Implementation of a baseline model, based only on kinematic data. Implementation of a model that predicts agent’s future actions, based on both kinematic and force data, by classifying agent's behavior into types.

title: Build a platform for testing the usability of configuration languages
description:
I am no longer accepting new registrations of interest as of Sunday 1st April for this project because I will be out of town part of the next week and will not be able to meet with new students.

Configuring computer systems such as networks and desktops is very labor intensive, particularly for large organizations. A small group of people simply cannot manage all the computers in an organization individually. To handle this problem, configuration management tools, such as Puppet, were created so that an Information Technologist (IT) could manage many computers using a single configuration language.

Despite the introduction of these languages, system administration remains a labor intensive and expensive area. Expressing configuration through these new languages is not easy and the languages have many odd corner cases which make it challenging to predict how a given configuration statement will be evaluated. For example, Puppet is supposed to be declarative in nature, but contains many non-declarative aspects like the ability to run something on the command line. These confusions potentially make the system hard to use making an already labor intensive task more so.

In this project you will be an online game-type system that could be used to test the usability of different configuration languages. The system will need to allow a player to configure several computers on a network and evaluate if the configuration is correct. Similar to my firewall games projects, this project is highly creative in nature. It is expected that a student will bring their own ideas and direction to the project. It is up to the student what programming languages they wish to use to accomplish the project. Both Unity as well as other standard web languages like Ruby or PHP could work well.

Students considering this project should visit the website below [1] and try playing some of the existing firewall games. While this project is conceptually different, the games should give a good idea of what a final product might look like.

The project has a range of difficulty levels, but is marked hard because the concept behind it is non-obvious. At the most basic level, the student would implement a single level, demonstrate that it works on a technical level, and evaluate its usability with a small number of people. A medium level of difficulty would involve also conducting a small usability study with the target population of system administrators. An advanced student might use the built system to study how the different aspects of the Puppet language impact how people solve different configuration tasks. 

MInf: This project is suitable for MInf students. ​The student would spend the first year focused on game design and development. In the second year, they would focus on using the designed game to evaluate the usability of different configuration languages, or aspects of configuration languages.
goal: Build an online game-like enviornment where participants have to configure a network using a set language
completion_criteria: Build a system which allows a player to set policy for several computers and see the results of those settings.

title: Haskell Notebooks: extending Jupyter/IHaskell
description:
Notebooks provide a popular web-based interface to a programming
language. Originally introduced for Mathematica, they are now available
for a range of languages including Python and Haskell.

The goal of this project is to improve Haskell support for IHaskell
notebooks by introducing automatically derived pretty-printers for
Haskell data structures that fit well with the IHaskell environment.
Previous projects on deriving (non-notebook) pretty printers for
Haskell can be taken as a starting point. Alternatively, one might
exploit the notebook to add new graphic datatypes to Haskell, similar
to those found in Dr Racket.
goal: Support Haskell notebooks with an automatically derived pretty printer, or with new graphics datatypes
completion_criteria: A library for Haskell to support deriving pretty printers or to support new graphics datatypes for Jupyter/IHaskell, available via Hackage and Cabal.

title: Probabilistic Time-Lapse Video Reconstruction
description:
The School is currently collecting two sets of images of the Bayes building construction, with a new image every 10 minutes,
over 12 hours / day, 5 days a week. See: http://homepages.inf.ed.ac.uk/rbf/DTI/dtibuild.htm

The proposed initial project is simply to construct a sensible time-lapse video of the construction site.This sounds easy but there are a number of complicating issues.

The most complex of the issues is the fact that lighting changes constantly between frames, between days, between seasons. This is due to clouds, sun movement, shadow movement, etc. Related to this is the change in the colour of surfaces due to rain, snow, paint, etc. Another complicating factor is slight camera movement arising from vibrations in the Forum and slight changes in the position of the  Forum as it warms up. The most complex factor, however, is the decision about what image content to include and what to omit. For example, if a worker is only seen at a given position in one frame, then they should probably be replaced with the background. But what about a piece of equipment that sits there for an hour, several hours or several days? And what if part of that equipment can move? And how to reconstruct background behind removed objects?

The initial goal of the project is to construct a reasonable time-lapsed video.However, there are bigger issues to explore here, as applicable to video data as a whole (e.g. surveillance video): 1) At what time scale should content be presented in a video? 2) How can activity with different time scales be detected and represented? 3) What makes for an attractive presentation?

A preliminary exploration of some of these ideas was undertaken by MSc student Reyes Ortiz: http://homepages.inf.ed.ac.uk/rbf/DISSERTATIONS/msc_20080666.pdf

This project would probably use a more probabilistic approach, including Conditional Random Field, as well as for reconstructing missing content.

Example images can be seen at: http://homepages.inf.ed.ac.uk/rbf/DTI/dtibuild.htm
goal: The project constructs a sensible time-lapse video of the Bayes building construction.
completion_criteria: Two videos, one from each of the 2 video cameras.

title: Cyclopath for Edinburgh
description:
Cyclopath is a project of the University of Minnesota that allows
cyclists to pool knowledge about the best cycle routes. The purpose
of this project is to set up and promote a Cyclopath instance for the
city of Edinburgh. The project will require and develop a mixture
of skills, both technical and social, as the goal is to build a system
that people actually use.
goal: Set up and promote a Cyclopath instance for the city of Edinburgh
completion_criteria: An installed and available Cyclopath instance for Edinburgh that people actually use.

title: Emojis usage in social media by demographics
description:
There have been several studies that analyse the usage and interpretation of emojis across platforms and applications [1,2,3]. In this project, we want to know if emojis are used differently by different personas. The main two categories of analysis are 1) gender: males/females, and 2) age: young/old. However, this can include other factors, such as countries, languages, and popularity on social media.

For each group of persona, the following analysis to be applied:

  1. Percentage of usage of emojis in each group
  2. Top used emojis
  3. Used in communication (replies, mentions) or in general posts
  4. Topics of usage

Once the analysis is performed, the next step will be building models for recommending emojis to social media users in their posts [3].

The work steps contain the following:

  1. Collecting millions of tweets with emojis in English at least, (Twitter API to be used)
  2. Applying one of the state-of-the-art methods for gender and age estimation of Twitter users [4]
  3. Performing statistical analysis for data
  4. Building emojis usage models for recommendation [3,5]
goal: Find the main differences/similarities of how emojis are used in social media by males/females of different ages
completion_criteria: Full analysis to emojis usage on social media by different demographics.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      +
Results are planned to be written in a paper for submission in a relevant conference.

title: Experimental study of computational phase transitions and correlation decay
description: Correlation decay [2] has became an important technique in approximate counting. The intuition is that when correlation decay happens, we only need to consider a certain local neighbourhood to recover the information of the variable of interests. In various circumstances, this technique is shown to be optimal, all the way up to the computational phase transition threshold, but there are still many problems for which it is not well-understood, e.g. [1]. In this project, you will look at the experimental effectiveness of the correlation decay technique.
goal: To study computational phase transitions and correlation decay
completion_criteria: Find out an asymptotically threshold of the correlation decay method for the hypergraph independent set problem.

title: UML Class Diagrams as an Ontology Language
description: UML class diagrams (UCDs) are a widely adopted formalism for modeling the intentional structure of a software system. Interestingly, it has been observed that an expressive fragment of UCDs can also serve as an ontology language. The goal of this project is to develop even further this idea, with the aim of implementing a prototype system for ontological reasoning under ontology languages based on UCDs, along with an experimental evaluation of its practical relevance.
goal: Implement a prototype system for ontological reasosning under ontologies based on UML class diagrams, along with an experimental evaluation of its practical relevance
completion_criteria: - Devise a practical algorithm for consistency checking of re-engineered UML class diagrams (this will rely on existing ideas)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                +

- Implement a prototype system                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                +
- Experimentally evaluate the practical relevance of the implemented prototype

title: An Apple App for Skin Lesion Tracking
description:
One of the key signs that a skin lesion (spot) is or has become
cancerous is a change in appearance. But how can you tell if
the lesion's appearance has changed? Most of us do not have a
very precise memory. Also, many lesions are in hard to view places
(e.g. your back).

This app will help solve these problems. Designed as a specialised
photo album manager, a user will be able to capture, catalog, compare
and communicate images.

A design sketch can be seen at:

    http://homepages.inf.ed.ac.uk/rbf/TRACKYOURSPOT/

This project will produce a real app, to be distributed via the
android app store.

As well as developing the app, the project will involve user testing
and refinement, and testing on a number of different apple devices
and versions.

A possible project extension is some simple image processing for
lighting compensation before image storage.

You will need to have an apple phone.
goal: To develop an app for identifying when a skin lesion has changed
completion_criteria: Development, evaluation, and deployment of the app.

title: System F in Polymorphic Blocks
description:
Quoting from the website: "Polymorphic Blocks are a novel block-based UI, in which a connector's shape visually represents the structure of the data being passed through the connector. We use Polymorphic Blocks to add visual type information to block-based programming environments like Blockly or Scratch." Polymorphic Blocks are implemented on top of Blockly, a JavaScript library for building user interfaces that manipulate graphical programs, created by Google.


The goal of this project is to apply Polymorphic Blocks to implement System F, the polymorphic lambda calculus of Girard and Reynolds, the system at the core of programming languages including Haskell, ML, and Scala. Success would show that graphic languages such as Blockly or Scratch can represent the full power of polymorphic programming
languages.
goal: Implement System F in Polymorphic Blocks
completion_criteria: Demonstrated and tested implementation of System F in Polymorphic Blockly.

title: Speech-driven animation of human heads in conversation using neural networks
description:
Automatic synthesis of realistic motions of a talking head (animated facial agent / avatar) is one of the crucial factors to make the talking head alive.
We have developed a novel system of head motion synthesis, in which smooth trajectories of head motions are automatically estimated from given speech signals using state-of-the-art deep neural auto-encoder and regression networks. In this project, we further explore the architecture to improve the performance. In particular, we seek to develop an auto-encoder that is trained with both speech and motion data so that the network learns relationships/interactions between speech and motions. This project seeks to extend the framework so that the head moves not only when the agent is speaking, but also the interlocutor is speaking and the agent is listening.
goal: To develop a system that automatically generates motion trajectories of a human head from speech in conversation using neural networks
completion_criteria: Develop a system that automatically estimates the motion trajectories of the head from speech signals of two people in conversation, create corresponding video clips of a talking head, and carry out objective and subjective evaluations.

title: An Android App for Skin Lesion Tracking
description:
One of the key signs that a skin lesion (spot) is or has become
cancerous is a change in appearance. But how can you tell if
the lesion's appearance has changed? Most of us do not have a
very precise memory. Also, many lesions are in hard to view places
(e.g. your back).

This app will help solve these problems. Designed as a specialised
photo album manager, a user will be able to capture, catalog, compare
and communicate images.

A design sketch can be seen at:

    http://homepages.inf.ed.ac.uk/rbf/TRACKYOURSPOT/

This project will produce a real app, to be distributed via the
android app store.

As well as developing the app, the project will involve user testing
and refinement, and testing on a number of different android devices
and versions.

A possible project extension is some simple image processing for
lighting compensation before image storage.

You will need to have an android phone.
goal: To develop an app for identifying when a skin lesion has changed.
completion_criteria: Development, evaluation, and deployment of the app.

title: GUI Authoring tool for XProc (XML Pipeline Language)
description: XProc: An XML Pipeline Language (http://www.w3.org/TR/xproc/) is a W3C standard which defines an XML language for specifying pipelines of XML processing.  It is essentially a dataflow language, including appropriate analogues for conditionals, loops and other traditional aspects of a programming language.  It is almost always introduced and explained by appeal to diagrams, but as yet there is no way to create XProc pipelines graphically.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              +
goal: Design and implement a GUI for building and running XML pipelines
completion_criteria: Implementation of a GUI for XProc which at least supports creation and export of pipelines whose steps are drawn from a reasonable subset of step types, including at least (non-nested) viewports and choices.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             +

description: The goal of this project is to fill this gap, by designing a GUI and implementing it, along with the means to export to XProc's official XML representation, and to import from it.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
completion_criteria: For a distinction, nesting, import and integration with Calabash

description: Probably best done in Java (e.g. Netbeans) but other host languages, or even an in-browser Javascript approach, might be possible.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +

Integration with Calabash (http://xmlcalabash.com/), the open-source XProc implementation, would be good but not necessary.\r
