                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            +
There is a design sketch for a GUI for an earlier XML pipeline language available as a starting point.

title: Parsing the LCFG configuration language
description:
LCFG is a configuration tool which is used to configure the DICE systems, and many other machines in the University. LCFG was a forerunner of modern configuration tools, and the language it implements is now comparatively old. It has an informal syntax with an ad-hoc parser, and this makes it difficult to produce other tools which process the same language, or to extend or experiment with the language.
The aim of this project is to create an explicit grammar for LCFG and to implement a prototype parser. This should form a basis on which to build further tools for processing configuration descriptions, and possibly identify ambiguities, or other problems with the language itself. The current implementation relies on tools such as the C preprocessor which support some features that are confusing and unnecessary in this context. The implemented grammar should therefore exclude some constructs which are currently permitted, and this may involve some investigation of how the language is actually used in real, live configurations.
As well as learning something about the configuration of large systems, this will provide you with practical experience of specifying, processing and parsing languages using tools such as Antlr (see below).
goal: Develop a grammar and associated parser for the LCFG configuration language
completion_criteria: A grammar and associated parser for the LCFG configuration language, together with an evaluation of this on real configuration examples.

title: Generating musical accompaniments (bass)
description:
When practicing (non-classical) music, it is often useful to have an accompaniment in the required key, at an appropriate tempo. Software such as Band-in-a-Box (commercial) or "Improvisor" (free) can generate sophisticated accompaniments, but these are complex programs which require some time for familarisation, and the accompaniment must be entered in a specific format. MuseScore is a (free) music notation application which reads and writes music in a standard MusicXML format.
Musescore can also play the notated music.

The goal of this project is to take a "leadsheet" (melody and chord symbols) in MusicXML format and add a part containing appropriate notes for MuseScore to be
able to play a bass line for the accompaniment.

Although there may be some scope for more conceptual work, for example in the construction of the bass line, this is primarily an "engineering", rather than a
"research" project.
goal: Create an application to synthesise a bassline for leadsheet in MusicXML format
completion_criteria: Working code, together with an evaluation.

title: Algorithms for Handling Multivariate Poisson Distributions
description:
Counts are ubiquitous in our environments. In sports, we count the number of goals or scores, in safety applications we count the number of fire outbreaks or infections and in neuroscience we count the number of neuronal spikes.

Very often, when looked at individually, these counts are Poisson distributed and thus easy to model one by one. However, modelling dependencies between these counts is also of great importance. There are various ways to construct and fit multivariate Poisson models, i.e. models with elements that are Poisson distributed when looked at individually.

This project is about bringing together various approaches that were developed for modelling and fitting multivariate Poisson distributions, implementing them in a Python package and validating them on artificial data.
goal: Combine and implement methods for modelling and fitting multivariate Poisson models.
completion_criteria: Implementations and validation of a Python package for modelling and fitting multivariate Poisson models.

title: Matrix and Tensor Factorizations with Bregman Divergences
description:
Non-negative matrix and tensor factorizations decompose a matrix or tensor into factors subject to the constraint that each factor is non-negative. This is useful for identifying patterns in high-dimensional data. Such factorizations can be implemented by means of iterative update rules. The most commonly used rules were derived under the assumption that the data elements are Gaussian distributed. However, if the data follow a different distribution then the standard update rules are no longer optimal.

Previous studies established a link between particular noise models and corresponding Bregman divergences. Following this work, update rules corresponding to other noise models can be readily obtained by plugging different divergences into quite general update rule equations.

This project is about the derivation of update rules for various useful noise models and their implementation and validation in the form of a Python package.
goal: Derivation of matrix factorization rules for various noise models, as well as their implementation and validation.
completion_criteria: Validated Python package implementing matrix factorization algorithms for various noise models.

title: IntelliJ IDEA plug-in for ThreadSafe static analysis tool
description:
IntelliJ IDEA is a popular IDE (integrated development environment) for Java, similar to Eclipse but preferred by many professional Java developers and the basis for Android Studio. ThreadSafe is a commercial static analysis tool for finding concurrency bugs in Java codebases. An existing ThreadSafe plug-in for Eclipse enables the user to conveniently run ThreadSafe on a Java codebase and investigate its findings with reference to lines in the codebase that relate to each bug report.

The goal of this project is to produce an open source plug-in for IntelliJ IDEA that provides similar functionality to the ThreadSafe plug-in for Eclipse, consuming an XML file containing ThreadSafe's findings.
goal: Produce a plug-in for IntelliJ IDEA that provides access to findings produced by the ThreadSafe static analysis engine
completion_criteria: A working plug-in for IntelliJ that consumes an XML file generated by the ThreadSafe analysis engine

title: Playing chord sequences on a mobile device
description:
When practicing (non-classical) music, it is often useful to have an accompaniment which plays the harmony in the required key, at an appropriate tempo. Software such as Band-in-a-Box (commercial) or "Improvisor" (free) can generate sophisticated accompaniments, but these are complex programs which require some time for familarisation and do not run on mobile devices. The goal of this project is to produce a mobile application (iOS or Android) which can take a simple (textual) list of chord symbols and produce a basic accompaniment with a given key and a given tempo.
Although there may be some scope for more conceptual work, for example in the selection of chord voicings, this is primarily an "engineering", rather than a "research" project.
goal: Create a mobile application to play a chord sequence in a given key and tempo
completion_criteria: Working code, together with an evaluation.

title: Generating musical accompaniments (chords)
description:
When practicing (non-classical) music, it is often useful to have an accompaniment in the required key, at an appropriate tempo. Software such as Band-in-a-Box (commercial) or "Improvisor" (free) can generate sophisticated accompaniments, but these are complex programs which require some time for familarisation, and the accompaniment must be entered in a specific format. MuseScore is a (free) music notation application which reads and writes music in a standard MusicXML format.
Musescore can also play the notated music.

The goal of this project is to take a "leadsheet" (melody and chord symbols) in MusicXML format and add a part containing appropriate notes for MuseScore to be
able to play the chords for the accompaniment.

Although there may be some scope for more conceptual work, for example in the choice of voicings and rhythm, this is primarily an "engineering",
rather than a "research" project.
goal: Create an application to synthesise an accompaniment for leadsheet in MusicXML format
completion_criteria: Working code, together with an evaluation.

title: PaxVis—Visualization and Engagement with the Peace-agreement Database
description:
The Peace Agreements Database and Access Tool (PA-X, peaceagreements.org) is a comprehensive database of peace agreements signed since 1990. It contains the full texts of >1500 agreements, both in pdf and OCRed text format. The contents of each document have been coded based on 225 substantive categories that note whether an issue (e.g. human rights, armed forces, elections) is mentioned in the text. Each document is also attached to a set of identifiers, such as date of signature, conflict type, document type, location, agreement parties, and similar.  


Goal of this data visualization project is to design and build an interactive visualization interface that helps peace analysts exploring the database, as well as getting the general public engaged in this data with the ability to flag insights, expose content, and create stories.  Specific questions the analysts are interested in include: which organizations are engaged in which conflicts, the history of certain peace agreements, types of governments, agreement clauses, geographies, relation of peace processes and conflict deaths, role of international organizations?


The leading research question is: which visualizations are useful to give people an overview over the database? How interactive do these visualizations need to be? How can a larger public be engaged in such a relevant dataset? The student will be expected to use their answers to these questions to produce usable visualizations and tools which can be placed on the website and used by end-users.  


Depending on interest and skill, this project can accommodate two MSc students, skilled in web development, interface design, graph design, and data visualization. A possible split could be that one student decides to research the exploratory interface and the visualizations, while the second focuses on concept and implementation for public engagement (e.g. through comments and questions, annotations, content sharing, personalization, querying, gaming, etc..). As this is an interdisciplinary project with strong collaboration between our collaborators in law, an elevated interest in the data around politics and peace is expected.


Links to related projects:     

  • http://ucdp.uu.se/

  • https://www.v-dem.net/en/analysis/analysis/

  • http://comparativeconstitutionsproject.org/chronology/
goal: Design / implementation / evaluation of interactive visualization interface
completion_criteria: Successful design, implementation and evaluation with user feedback.

title: Interactive Visual Exploration of Similarity in Machine Learning Classifications
description:
This project is about human-in-the-loop machine learning, in particular
classification. You will design a visual analytics interface that allows
users to assess the similarity between two networks (e.g. friendship
networks or biological networks). The networks may consist of several
thousand nodes, so that the interface should allow the user to easily
explore possible differences regarding network properties such as
density, presence of links, network measures etc. The interface should
support the user to assign a numerical similarity score to the two networks.
goal: Design and development of interactive visualization interface for a machine learning system
completion_criteria: - Software that implements the visual analytics interface                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +
- Experimental validation on graphs with known properties

title: Augmenting Common Crawl with PDF files
description:
Common Crawl [1] (CC) has been taking large samples of the Web more or less every month for over five years.   Recent months have over 2 x 10^9 pages.  A 2017 MSc project [2], [3] used the April 2014 and April 2017 samples to track the use of one particular class of URIs, those using a particular redirecting proxy.  The results are biased by the fact that CC only reports on HTML-format files.  PDF is a common publication format for a wide range of document types, and a companion collection of such files would be very useful.  This project has three parts:

1) Use the outgoing links metadata from the CC 4/14 and 4/17 samples to harvest links to PDF documents;

2) Retrieve as many contemporary linked-to PDF documents as we can find room for, possibly using the Wayback machine [4];

3) Annotate each stored document with information about its outgoing links, and use this to replicate the work reported in [3].

Access to cloud-based multiprocessor (Microsoft Azure) may be available, otherwise an _ad-hoc_ multiprocessor made up of unused lab machines overnight will be needed for accessing/processing the large amounts of data involved.
goal: Collect and extract links from a sample of PDF files based on Common Crawl's sample of HTML files
completion_criteria: Minimum necessary: Complete (1) and at least some of (2);                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +

Good result: Complete (2) and the annotation part of (3);                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +
Excellent result: Complete (3)

title: Generating background music
description:
Most of the current music is under copyright. This means it is often hard to find a suitable background song when making a video.

The goal of this project is to create an application, that will be able to synthesize song by given settings (such as music genre, length, tempo, chord progressions) and a timeline of the song dynamics. The application will generate a "leadsheet" (melody and chord symbols) in MusicXML format and write down appropriate notes for each instrument, which can be later played by a software such as MuseScore, a free music notation application.
goal: Create an application to synthesise songs in MusicXML format
completion_criteria: Working code, together with an evaluation.

title: Is Common Crawl a reliable source of Web statistics?
description:
Common Crawl [1] has been taking large samples of the Web more or less every month for over five years.   Recent months have over 2 x 10^9 pages.  A 2017 MSc project [2], [3] used the April 2014 and April 2017 samples to track the use of one particular class of URIs, those using a particular redirecting proxy.  The value of this work is however unclear, as we don't really know how reliable the Common Crawl sample actually is.  In our paper [3] we raise a number of specific reliability questions, which this project should try to answer.  There are at least three types of question to be addressed:

1) (Easy) The samples actually come in three different forms:  full, text-only and metadata-only.  Are they accurate?  That is, is the full version of a file byte-for-byte the same as what was actually on the web at the time of retrieval?  Are the text-only and metadata-only versions faithful to the originals?  The latter questions can be answered by comparing the three different versions of the samples, but the former needs cross-checking with what the Wayback machine [5] reports.

2) (Medium) Common Crawl reports [4] estimates of duplication between different crawls as well as within crawls.  The accuracy of these reports needs to be checked.

3) (Hard) How representative of the whole Web is the CC sample?  It's not obvious how to measure this:  part of the project will be to explore what suggestions have been made and what implementations have been done for similar efforts.

Access to cloud-based multiprocessor (Microsoft Azure) may be available, otherwise an _ad-hoc_ multiprocessor made up of unused lab machines overnight will be needed for accessing/processing the large amounts of data involved
goal: Evaluate the representativeness of the Common Crawl web sampling project and do QA on its metadata
completion_criteria: Minimum necessary: determine the origin(s) of the URI-reporting problems identified in [3] for the WAT-format samples, and tabulate their frequency over at least one month per year for the last 5 years.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +

Good result: Extend this to the rest of the metadata in the WAT files, and do the harder part (checking the with the Wayback) of task (1).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    +
Excellent result: Do task (2) and/or (3)

title: Write an LLVM compiler backend for the TI MSP430
description: The TI MSP430 is a popular embedded processor [1] with a GCC compiler. In this project we will create an LLVM toolchain for the MSP430 that it is capable of compiling integer and floating point programs. There is a partial implementation of a LLVM backend for the MSP430 on GitHub [2] that we will extend. This is a good project for someone who wants to learn more about compiler backends, LLVM and embedded systems development. This project is programming intensive and suitable for someone who is already comfortable programming in C++. There is a TODO list for the existing backend on GitHub [2] that we will begin addressing. To test the compiler we will use a software simulator and a MSP430 evaluation board [3].
goal: Support in LLVM for compiling and running simple programs on the TI MSP430
completion_criteria: Implement support in LLVM to compile integer and floating point C/C++ programs to the TI MSP430. Each student will be responsible for a major feature such as 'functional calling conventions', 'variable arguments support', 'software floating point support' that they will deliver along with tests and source code changes at the end of the project.

title: Automatic Video Director with Web Streaming Platform for Live Events
description:
Introduction

Video streaming is becoming more and more popular, especially after Facebook and YouTube added live streaming as a feature in their platforms. There are many companies that provide video capturing solutions and online streaming for various events like conferences, sports matches, and corporate events.


Problems

However, there are big problems that arise:


  • There is no unified standard and protocol for streaming video on the web and the variety of different platforms of the client devices that do not support the same protocols, video containers and codecs. Sometimes features of the protocols are missing on some devices and there is no way to get information about the supported systems using the Javascript APIs available on the browser. For example, different HLS versions are supported on Android and iOS devices which lack features. Or some devices are unable to parse MPEG-TS video containers and the samples have to be repackaged in MP4 containers on the fly on the client device to save server bandwidth and storage.
  • Many clients require the platform to support many features like multiple audio streams and captions in different languages in the cases of simultaneous translation in multiple languages at events and not all of the available solutions have those capabilities.
  • Sometimes there are many clients connected to a server, which leads to high bandwidth usage that requires the employment of CDNs, which in turn make costs bigger.
  • Many events are happening simultaneously on different sites and for small streaming companies it is not feasible to hire multiple directors on salary only to work on occasion or having an on-site director to mix the video streams from multiple cameras and deal with the on-screen captions realtime drives up the costs of the service.

Focus

The main focus of this project is to explore solutions for the aforementioned problems by creating a small PoC platform that employs different streaming technologies and use it to explore the ramifications of an automatic director system for live events.

Automatic Director

The Automatic Director’s goal is to be able to select a camera to show out of several video feeds focusing the attention of the viewer towards the main activity, resulting in consistent cuts. Since there is broad spectrum of various types of events (for example sports and talk shows), such a program will only focus on two or three most common types, which are educational streams (such as lectures), interviews with two or three people, and stage events, such as speakers at a conference. For this purpose, a Hidden Markov Model will be used for the transitions and different machine learning algorithms will be explored to label and classify the scenes from the array of cameras. Also, more often than not, we cannot rely on microphone data to choose a cut because the audio is either provided by the venue audio engineer, there are too few microphones and using a simple gate on the microphone level’s to map the microphones to the cameras is not feasible.


There are enterprise solutions available but they require proprietary hardware, whereas the goal here is to use a general-computation device such as a laptop or a server machine. Moreover, I could find only two published papers on the topic, the more interesting being the Stanford’s “Computational Video Editing for Dialogue-Driven Scenes” research cited below, which focuses on dialogues only. The program might be developed as a stand-alone implementation or as a plugin for video mixing software such as VMix or OBS Studio depending on the SDKs and time available.

The Platform

The streaming platform will be based on the video.js framework and will be deployed on the existing infrastructure of https://streamer.bg. Various protocols and technologies will be used such as HLS, RTMP, and WebRTC. There are several challenges in making all of them be able to support the basic features required for live-streamed events, which are:

  • Multiple video resolutions for adaptive streaming
  • Multiple audio streams for different languages
  • Partial subtitles and captions support
  • Interruptions in the stream due to breaks during the events.


The last one is the most challenging due to the nature of the protocols, HLS in particular, and the implementations of different streaming servers that vary due to a lack of official solution described in the protocol specification.


There are different servers such as crtmpserver and the nginx-rtmp plugin that can be used and extended to support the functionalities.

Evaluation

The whole platform will be evaluated and tested on different hardware and virtual devices with a wide range of operating systems (Windows, Linux, Mac, Android, iOS), and their different versions, and various web browsers such as Firefox, Chrome, Edge and the mobile counterparts. The Automatic Director will be evaluated by presenting several people with sample video output and they will be asked to subjectively grade how “good” and “meaningful” the cuts and angles are.
goal: To develop an end-to-end online video streaming platform for the Web and Implement an Automatic Video Director for unsupervised event streaming
completion_criteria: The project will be considered successful if the video stream is able to run on most modern devices and at least half of them support the advanced features such as the interruptions in streams and multiple audio selection. Also, the Automatic video director has to be able to produce cuts that are graded better than randomly choosing cuts every several seconds (for example, the average duration of a cut in a video or movie), which is going to be the baseline.

title: Visualizing and Analysing Large Networks in the Browser
description:
The Vistorian (http://vistorian.net) is an online platform for interactive network visualization. It is fully running in the browser, without any server backend. However, this approach, currently constrains the size of the networks loaded to 5MB, though modern browsers have build-in databases that can store up to 5MB, e.g. WebSQL (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_SQL_Database). The goal of the project is to load networks into the browser, larger than 5MB. The Vistorian is used by historians to visualize social historical networks.

This project has two aspects, possibly taken by different students:

  • exploiting the browsers support to store and query large networks through a JavaScript API,

  • create a corresponding linkage to load data from graph databases (e.g. Neo4J: https://neo4j.com).


The overarching goal is to bring the power of large network visualization to the browser, without the need for people to install and update software tools on their local HD. This topic requires some knowledge in SQL and data bases, JavaScript as well as interest in networks and visualization.
goal: Implementation and testing of browser database for network visualization
completion_criteria: Loading large networks into browser.

title: HaskellQuest: a game for teaching functional programming in Haskell
description:
ScalaQuest is a game that teaches programming in Scala. Playing the game involves solving a series of challenges relating to Scala programming, with the difficulty of the challenges increasing as the player advances through the levels of the game. Learning in the context of the game increases engagement and makes learning fun.

This project will take inspiration from ScalaQuest to produce a similar game that teaches programming in the Haskell functional programming language. A game development platform like Unity will be used to cut down the amount of effort required to produce a working game.

If you register interest in this project, please send answers to these questions to dts@inf.ed.ac.uk.
goal: Produce a game to teach functional programming in Haskell, inspired by ScalaQuest
completion_criteria: Prototype game that teaches some concepts from Haskell, covering at least expressions, function definitions, types, lists, list comprehensions, and recursive definitions.

title: Sharing is Caring: Implementing Virtualised Wi-Fi
description: In popular locations, such as airports, stadiums, and cafés, Wi-Fi infrastructure is frequently managed by local businesses and wireless service providers are required to share the access points (APs). While bandwidth partitioning can be easily handled by the AP for the downlink, this is a difficult task for the uplink, since Wi-Fi operates with a decentralised medium access protocol. \r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   +
goal: Implement a Wi-Fi virtualisation mechanism for commodity access points, that enables wireless infrastructure sharing among multiple operators.
completion_criteria: A prototype system that enables the virtualisation of wireless access points.

description: To tackle this problem, we have designed a virtualisation algorithm that can be executed at the access point, without requiring modifications to the end-user equipment. The algorithm manipulates dynamically the contention configurations, in order to distribute the available bandwidth among service providers according to contracted shares.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   +

The aim of this project is to develop a prototype implementation of this virtualisation mechanism, using off-the-shelf APs, in order to demonstrate its practical feasibility and identify possible performance limitations.

title: Solving terms in the Lukasiewicz mu-calculus.
description: The Lukasiewicz mu-calculus was introduced by Mio and Simpson and incorporates probability when reasoning about systems. A term in this calculus denotes a number, the problem is to find the number given a term. An algorithm was given by Mio and Simpson but they state that the worst case analysis leads to an "abysmal" bound. (However it seems very likely that the algorithm is good in practice.) An alternative algorithm was developed by Kalorkoti, the worst case here is single exponential (again the runtime is likely to be better in practice). The aim of this project is to implement the second approach with some timing studies as well as check the effect of some heuristics on the runtime of the algorithm.
goal: Implement and evaluate one algorithm for solving Lukasiewicz mu-calculus terms.
completion_criteria: A complete implementation and timing studies of the main algorithm.

title: Dynamic Networks Analytics
description:
Networks (e.g., social networks, biological protein-protein interaction networks, brain connectivity) are analyzed using a variety of network measures (density, centrality, clustering, etc.). Common libraries for network measures are implemented in R or Python (e.g., NetworkX). However, both R and python do not provide any network visualization capabilities beyond plotting node-link diagrams.


The Vistorian (http://vistorian.net) is an online platform for network visualization that offers interactive exploration of dynamic, geographic, and multivariate networks. Goal of this project is to conceptualize and implement network measures and analytics into the Vistorian which allows for an interactive exploration of measures on these networks. Most important are dynamic measures, complementary to the network visualizations. The essential question is how can network measures driven an interactive exploration and how can an interactive exploration help the refinement and exploration of measures (when is density highest? When is the network most disconnected? How often does the density falls below a certain value, etc..)
goal: Implement visualization (interactive) visualization techniques
completion_criteria: Implement a set of 5-8 network measures and make their exploration interactive.

title: Data in cognitive science: Standards, storage, and model evaluation
description:
In cognitive science and psychology, researchers often build computational models to explain and predict human behavior.These models are often evaluated or compared in ad-hoc and problematic ways, with the following issues being commonplace:

* Models are often fitted or trained on the same data that are used to test them.

* Models are evaluated on small data sets that have been selected to emphasize their strengths.

* Measures of performance are often ad-hoc, and may be poor reflections of the actual or intuitive performance of models.

This project will provide a framework for evaluating models in a more rigorous and standardized way, framing them as machine problems and using a standardized set of performance criteria. While this is a large and open-ended problem in general, it is expected that a proof-of-concept in one or two example domains will be within the scope of a UG4 project, and can be divided into the following pieces; 1 and 2 are sufficiently modular that multiple students will be able to work on them in parallel:

1. Coming up with a machine-readable description for data and human judgments in a specific family of psychological experiments (``function learning'') that corresponds closely to regression problems, and infrastructure (i.e., a database-based web application) for uploading, downloading, and exploring data sets.

2. Building a framework for running and evaluating third-party predictive models in supervised and unsupervised contexts. This may require writing few interfaces to allow these models to work with the descriptions chosen in (1).

3. Running this framework using at least three existing models and three data sets.
goal: To build tools that support automatically evaluating cognitive models against experimental data sets
completion_criteria: 1. The development of one or more machine-readable data formats (potentially based on csv/json) that are general enough to cover experiments from at least four different papers, including both human judgments and a clear specification of the experimental design, and a web application for uploading/downloading data in those formats and visualizing aspects of the data.                                                                                             +

OR                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        +

2. A working system that can take third-party computational models satisfying a given I/O specification, evaluate them according to several criteria, and report the evaluation results, and modifications to three existing computational models to allow them to satisfy the I/O specification.

title: Event Ordering from News Articles
description:
The goal of this project is to take as input a set of articles, and output the events in these articles in the form of predicate argument structure. In addition, the student would be required to create an  algorithm that orders these events in time.

This means the algorithm should take as input the set of events, and create a chain (or a directed acyclic graph, really, in case of unknown relations between  events) that tells which event appeared before another.
goal: development of an event ordering algorithm
completion_criteria: developing an event ordering algorithm and applying it to news article or other data

title: Towards building the spectral theory of directed graphs
description:
Spectral graph theory investigates the algebraic properties of matrices associated with graphs. Over the past decade, studies in spectral graph theory have successfully overcome fundamental bottlenecks faced by combinatorial algorithms, and have become a major research focus of theoretical computer science, machine learning, and network analysis. Most studies in spectral graph theory focus on undirected graphs, since the eigenvalues of the adjacency matrices of undirected graphs are real-valued. However, most graphs occurring in practice are directed, e.g., the Facebook graph and the Twitter network. Developing the spectral theory of directed graphs is of great importance both in theory and practice. 


In this project, we will study Hermitian matrix representation of directed graphs, and see to which extent classical results in algebraic properties of undirected graphs can be generated into the setting of directed graphs. 

Successful completion of the project could lead to a publishable result in algorithms and discrete mathematics.
goal: Investigate the power and limits of Hermitian matrices in studying directed graphs
completion_criteria: Develop new results about Hermitian matrix representation of directed graphs.

title: implementing efficient (randomized) algorithms for comparing integers succinctly represented by arithmetic circuits
description:
Consider the following trivial-sounding problem:

we are given two integers  n and m, and we want to decide whether the numbers are equal or not.

This is trivial to do if the numbers n and m are represented in binary.

However, for this project,  the numbers n and m are not represented in binary notation.   Instead, they are represented

more succinctly, by  arithmetic circuits (straight-line programs),  that use addition and multiplication (and binary

integers as inputs to these arithmetic circuits).


The only known efficient (polynomial time) algorithm for this problem when both addition and multiplication are allowed

requires the use of randomization (and finding a deterministic algorithm would constitute a major breakthrough, because it

would de-randomize "polynomial identity testing").

The randomized algorithm is simple:   randomly choose a "suitably large enough" prime number p , and  compute both

arithmetic circuits mod that random prime number.    Then compare the result (mod p) of the two circuits.    If these are equal,

then answer "yes".  If it is not equal then answer "no".    If the two circuits define equal numbers n and m,

then this algorithm always answers "yes".   If the two circuits define different numbers n and m, then this algorithm

answers no "with high probability".


In a second scenario,   imagine that the two arithmetic circuits representing m and n   ONLY use multiplication.

In this case we do have an efficient (polynomial time) deterministic algorithm for comparing the integers.

(See [Etessami-Stewart-Yannakakis'14]), which is an iterative algorithm that requires repeated computation of the

greatest common divisor of pairs of integers (which can of course be computed efficiently).

Furthermore, for numbers n and m reprsented by circuits using only multiplication,    assuming certain deep number-theoretic conjectures are true,

there is also an efficient (polynomial time) deterministic algorithm for deciding whether   n is greater than or equal to m.   ( This algorithm requires  computation of

logarithms to desired accuracy, and also relies on the deterministic algorithm for checking equality.

(See [Etessami-Stewart-Yannakakis'14]).


This project asks to implement all three of these algorithms, and to see how they perform in practice by  testing them on many instances of integers defined by arithmetic circuits.
goal: the goal is to implement a basic (in fact classic) randomized algorithm for checking equality of two integers when these integers are each represented succinctly by arithmetic circuits using addition and multiplication,     and also implementing a deterministic algorithm for equality checking in the case where only multiplication is used.
completion_criteria: Working implementation of at least two of the three described algorithms for comparing integers represented by arithmetic circuits.

title: reachability algorithms for Branching Markov Decision Processes
description: Markov decision processes are a fundamental model of stochastic\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              +
goal: Understand and implement new algorithms for computing optimal reachability probabilities for Branching Markov decision processes
completion_criteria: Completion will be judged by whether there is a running\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     +

description: dynamic optimization and optimal control.\r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              +
completion_criteria: implementation of the reachability \r                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         +
analysis algorithms for Branching MDPs.

description: Branching Markov Decision Processes are a class of finitely-presented\r
